Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a simple shape that may represent a fish (limited details or accuracy).
The student may attempt to draw water as a feature around the fish (simple lines or shapes, but not clearly labeled).
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to label the fish accurately or provide any labels without prompting (student does not understand labeling).
The student is unlikely to show or label what the fish needs to survive such as water and food (student does not grasp the survival needs).
The student cannot show or label other plants or animals in the habitat (lacks understanding of habitat interconnections).
The student cannot represent how the fish and its habitat are part of a system (no concept of environmental systems).
